trans-unit.source: Creates a reference to a COM object from the given classname.

seg-source.mrk: Creates a reference to a COM object from the given classname.

target.mrk: Creates a reference to a COM object from the given classname.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
The class of the object in the following format: "appname.objectype"

seg-source.mrk: The class of the object in the following format:

target.mrk: The class of the object in the following format:

trans-unit.source: It can also be a string representation of the CLSID.

seg-source.mrk: It can also be a string representation of the CLSID.

target.mrk: It can also be a string representation of the CLSID.

trans-unit.source: [optional] name of a remote computer from which the object must be obtained.

seg-source.mrk: name of a remote computer from which the object must be obtained.

target.mrk: name of a remote computer from which the object must be obtained.

trans-unit.source: [optional] name of a usercode on the remote computer.

seg-source.mrk: name of a usercode on the remote computer.

target.mrk: name of a usercode on the remote computer.

trans-unit.source: You have to enter this in the format "computer\usercode" or "domain\usercode".

seg-source.mrk: You have to enter this in the format "computer\usercode" or "domain\usercode".

target.mrk: You have to enter this in the format "computer\usercode" or "domain\usercode".

trans-unit.source: [optional] password for the usercode on the remote computer.

seg-source.mrk: password for the usercode on the remote computer.

target.mrk: password for the usercode on the remote computer.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
an object.
sets the @error flag to non-zero.
Remarks
Use ObjCreate() if you want to have a new instance of the referring application.

seg-source.mrk: Use ObjCreate() if you want to have a new instance of the referring application.

target.mrk: Use ObjCreate() if you want to have a new instance of the referring application.

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect to an existing process, use ObjGet() instead.

seg-source.mrk: If you want to connect to an existing process, use ObjGet() instead.

target.mrk: If you want to connect to an existing process, use ObjGet() instead.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that not all computers have the same set of Objects. So always check for errors after calling ObjCreate(). To check errors use ObjEvent().

seg-source.mrk: Keep in mind that not all computers have the same set of Objects.
So always check for errors after calling ObjCreate().

target.mrk: Keep in mind that not all computers have the same set of Objects.
So always check for errors after calling ObjCreate().

trans-unit.source: The following requirements apply if you want to access objects on remote computers:

seg-source.mrk: The following requirements apply if you want to access objects on remote computers:

target.mrk: The following requirements apply if you want to access objects on remote computers:

trans-unit.source: The user running the script must have the appropriate permissions.

seg-source.mrk: The user running the script must have the appropriate permissions.

target.mrk: The user running the script must have the appropriate permissions.

trans-unit.source: The Object on the remote computer must support DCOM (Distributed COM)

seg-source.mrk: The Object on the remote computer must support DCOM (Distributed COM)

target.mrk: The Object on the remote computer must support DCOM (Distributed COM)

trans-unit.source: The remote computer must have 'Remote Registry Service' and 'File and Printer sharing' services running.

seg-source.mrk: The remote computer must have 'Remote Registry Service' and 'File and Printer sharing' services running.

target.mrk: The remote computer must have 'Remote Registry Service' and 'File and Printer sharing' services running.

trans-unit.source: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

seg-source.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

target.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.
